channel.title: Auxy for Mac (Real)
channel.description: This is not a drill. Apple just announced iOS apps running virtually on macOS at WWDC 2020. More details to come :)

item.title: Auxy for Mac (Real)
item.dc:creator: icelight
item.description:
No unfortunately, a developer can disable the app being available on Mac automatically, which has happened here (since it can mean providing extra support for bugs etc.)

Read full topic

item.title: Auxy for Mac (Real)
item.dc:creator: jmoore104
item.description:
Did this ever happen (for real)? I bought an M1 MacBook a few months ago in part because of the expected ability to run Auxy on the Mac finally. But I feel like an idiot because I cannot figure out how to do it. All I find in the App Store is like a really old version of Auxy that’s nothing like the iPad version. Can someone tell me how do I download this? Do I need to link my subscription info somehow? Thanks!

Read full topic

item.description:
I hope it’s real. I do most of my work on my mac and switching to the ipad just for auxy is a bit of a hassle.

Read full topic

item.title: Auxy for Mac (Real)
item.dc:creator: TheRealJFalc
item.description:
From what I understand, while Surface Pro X hasn’t sold very well, it’s a much better experience on ARM than Windows RT was, or so I understand. So it’s still a possibility that boot camp may work. Although I doubt any of the things you’d really want to dual boot for would function.

Read full topic

item.title: Auxy for Mac (Real)
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
Yeah they have stuff running on power sipping chipsets, but totally different instruction set. Mobile windows stuff still runs intel, not ARM. So it’s just not gonna happen.

With that said, I agree it’s like PowerPC all over again, which honestly, I don’t recall (only started using macs about three years ago) - I hope it’s more straightforward- we’ll see. From what I understand it wasn’t the worst going from PowerPC to Intel, but this is a bit different…

Read full topic

item.title: Auxy for Mac (Real)
item.dc:creator: TheRealJFalc
item.description:
I mean, it’s not like Windows doesn’t have an ARM variant. But… Windows RT was a huge flop and the surface pro x doesn’t seem like it’s getting any traction either.

You also have to factor in the price of early adoption. I am sure it’s going to be a huge mess with developers scrambling to get stuff running natively on the new architecture. I’d never want to be an early adopter in this case. Look how bad the transition from PowerPC was for users who just bought into the ecosystem. And now history is repeating itself with the Mac Pro being two years from literal obsolescence as the transition is stated to be completely changed in those two years with dropped support for x86.

Read full topic

item.title: Auxy for Mac (Real)
item.dc:creator: El1011
item.description:
Just watched a Snazzy Labs video and according to him, iphone/ipad apps will automatically be added to the mac app store by default and devs actually have to opt-out to not have that happen. So unless lenberg & co. decide to opt out, auxy for mac will be a thing on day 1 for those that have an arm mac.

Read full topic

item.title: Auxy for Mac (Real)

item.description:
Yea, I guess I could just run a vm, if anyone does happen to find a way without vm pls lmk

Read full topic

XLXK:

parallel has worked on my old 2010 Mac to run Windows applications natively

item.title: Auxy for Mac (Real)
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
Yeah but iOS apps have never run on Windows, ever. This will be the first time they potentially will run on a Mac, natively.

Parallels and bootcamp a different story. Wondering actually how those will work on NON intel chipsets… stuff I’ve read seems quite vague. They’ll happily run Linux/Unix variants, but I dunno… time will tell.

Read full topic

item.title: Auxy for Mac (Real)
item.dc:creator: XLXK
item.description:
I mean, you could be right, but parallel has worked on my old 2010 Mac to run Windows applications natively

Read full topic

item.title: Auxy for Mac (Real)
item.dc:creator: XLXK
item.description:
I’m pretty sure there is a way to dual boot Mac on a windows pc currently. Do you think someone might release the new Mac OS installer so I can dual boot on my Pc? Or perhaps just install some 3rd party drivers to run iOS apps natively on windows?

item.title: Auxy for Mac (Real)
item.dc:creator: Velocity
item.description:
The macs with Apple Silicon chips will be released sometime this fall, with development units shipping now. Apple silicon may or may not cost more or less than the Intel processor, but it is expected to be more expensive during the first few months of production.

Read full topic

item.title: Auxy for Mac (Real)
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
Yep. I’d just hope development cycles aren’t wasted on bringing a touch app to a natively non touch device - an app with no other input method.

Read full topic

item.title: Auxy for Mac (Real)
item.dc:creator: brandnaqua
item.description:
It is not certain that it will NOT work on Intel Macs, because iPad apps can be converted using Catalyst, but that requires developer intervention. With the new Apple Silicon Macs iPad/iOS apps would run natively with just a selected checkbox by the developer.

Read full topic

item.title: Auxy for Mac (Real)
item.dc:creator: crystldawnmusic
item.description:
No, you can’t run Auxy on any type of Mac unless you buy one of the upcoming ARM ones (which are not released yet), and Lenberg and Co. opts in to letting Auxy run there.

Read full topic
